page.title: 08ARCHBISHOP CRANMER SCHOOL
page.content: Aslockton primary school is called Achbishop Cranmer Church of England primary school.It was opened 17 years ago in 1968 by the then Secretary of state for education Margaret Thatcher. On the first day about 170 children came to school, now there are 138 children in the school. The first teacher employed apart from the headmaster (Mr Twells)was Mr Stavely.There are 8 classrooms and 3 dining rooms and 17 other rooms in the school.Before this school was opened the children used to go to small village schools in Scarrington, Hawksworth,Thoroton and Whatton. At the moment the school has two computers, a music centre, several tape recorders and a television for watching schools programmes. We study maths, science, english, art and topic, which is all subjects.
